summary.p: 6 fol. on parchment; Shelfmark: Marcel 60; Qurʾānic Text: Q 8:10-8:46; 11 lines per page; Dimensions: 286 x 198mm; Script style: kūfī D.I.
The fragment Arabe 352 (c) (BNF) belongs to the same manuscript.

This entry was created on the basis of the information made available by Valery V. Polosin (1939-2014), without use of manuscript images. Therefore, the exact distribution of the Qurʾānic passages across the manuscript pages is unknown to us, and all the passages are shown as belonging to fol. 1. The catalogue entry by Polosin contains the following information:

6 fol. 198×286 mm (1.444). Support: thin and transparent parchment, on some sheets wrinkled of yellowish color; the difference between the flesh and hair sides is hardly visible. Writing material: black and brown ink.
Collation: one incomplete quire; fol. 1 and 6, 3 and 4 are bifolia, fol. 2 and 5 are singletons with stubs.
I: H1F H2F S H3F / F4H F5H S F6H.
Text layout: 128/130×200 mm (1.54/1.5625), 11 lines. Ruling: absent. Script: D I, rather small. Diacritics: short rhomboid dashes in black ink. Vocalization: round red dots, occasionally green dots.

Verse markers: for groups of ten verses – golden letter ﻪ (hā); for groups of ten verses –medallions in the text line (type 2''A.II) in gold and colors, with the inscribed verse numbers signified by letters according to the abjad system (ي – fol. 1r, ﻙ - fol. 2v, ﻝ - fol. 4r), ﻡ - fol. 5v).

Inscriptions: numbers of surahs inscribed in Roman numerals in black ink on the upper margins of all sheets (except fol. 6r) with the number of initial verse on the page in Arabic numerals (except fol. 4v, 5r, 6v); verse numbers are also marked in the text.
Stitching: thread is preserved in the punctures of the fold.

Defects: minor stains; outer margins slightly damafes, probably by fire and rodents; parchment slightly damaged by aggressive ink on fol. 1v, beginning f line 3, under the word overwritten on the erased text; in the lower part of the same page the ink has slightly peeled off.
Old accession numbers: B. 37 (according to Langlois’ inventory).
Fol. 1r–6v. Surah 8, verses 10(10)-48(46). Incipit: [قلوبكم] و ما النصر الا عند الله . Explicit: فتفشلوا وتذ[هب ريحكم] .
Other fragments of the same manuscript: Arabe 352c (BNF)."
Olga Yastrebova has translated and sometimes corrected the notes of V. Polosin. Corrected passages are marked with ОЯ (O.Ya).
